pub.citation: Biffin et al. 2010 (Annals of Botany 106: 79-93) and Lucas et al. 2007 (Taxon 56: 1105-1128).

pmmd.notes: Hand assembled; the species of polyphyletic genera were represented with their epithet, in contrary to monophyletic genera that were represented only by the genera name. In some cases, polyphyletic genera contained clear resolved clades within it, in this case each of them were numbered (i.e. myrcia1, myrcia2...).
